heading: Zombie Chess
description: is a game where you bury each piece you capture under one of your pieces. If you move off a buried piece, it comes back from the dead as a zombie. (2 players, chess set, coins, pencils, and paper)

heading: Masquerade Chess
description: is a combination of chess and deduction games like Mastermind. Pieces move regularly, except when they capture. Start the game by choosing which capture moves each of your opponent's pieces will use, then try to deduce how each of your pieces can capture. (2 players, chess set, pencils, and paper)

heading: Adrenaline Chess
description: adds power ups to chess. (2 players, chess set, and checkers set)

heading: Booster Chess
description: use cards to boost your chess army. (2 players, chess set, checkers set, and deck of cards)

heading: Chess Golf
description: makes players race to plan the best route, as the pieces caddy each other around the board. (1 or more players, chess set, deck of cards, timer, coins, pencil and paper)

heading: Crowded House
description: is the only four-player game I know of on a standard chess set. (4 players and chess set)

heading: Cooperative Chess
description: lets you play together against the game. (2 players, chess set, and deck of cards)

heading: Half Alice Chess
description: moves pieces through the looking glass to a parallel universe after each move. (2 players, chess set, and checkers set)

heading: Chess960
description: is a game designed by Bobby Fischer to mix up the game opening by randomly choosing your starting position. (2 players, chess set, and deck of cards)

heading: Appendix A
description: shows which playing cards represent each chess piece.
